title: How to Stop Sheets from Wrapping Around the Clothesline

steps.headline: Assemble the pegs (clothes pins), washing basket, and a 1.5 liter (0.4 US gal) soda bottle half filled with water and sealed.
steps.description: These are to go to the clothesline as well as the sheets.

steps.headline: Peg (pin) the sheets to one line.
steps.description: Now, lift the other end up and peg (pin) it onto the next parallel line. The aim is to create a cradle shape out of the sheet and to have all of it pegged to the line.

steps.headline: Toss the water bottle into the middle of the sheet.
steps.description: It will sit there, anchoring down the sheet. The sheet will stay in position while drying and won't wrap around the clothesline.

text: Wash the sheets as usual.  Assemble the pegs (clothes pins), washing basket, and a 1.5 liter (0.4 US gal) soda bottle half filled with water and sealed. These are to go to the clothesline as well as the sheets. Peg (pin) the sheets to one line. Now, lift the other end up and peg (pin) it onto the next parallel line. The aim is to create a cradle shape out of the sheet and to have all of it pegged to the line. Toss the water bottle into the middle of the sheet. It will sit there, anchoring down the sheet. The sheet will stay in position while drying and won't wrap around the clothesline. Repeat with any other sheets.
